intro: Pimpinella triradiata, commonly known as the three-rayed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind, and it has a short growing season. Pimpinella triradiata is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
